articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military said on Tuesday it struck dozens of Hezbollah targets in southern Lebanon overnight, a day after it launched a wave of airstrikes against the Iran-backed group's sites in Lebanon's deadliest day in decades.
articles.title: Israel and Hezbollah exchange fire after Lebanon suffers huge casualties

articles.author: Manuel Ausloos
articles.description: With more Israeli communities moving into Hezbollah's crosshairs as Israel hits deeper in Lebanon, some in northern Israel hoped their country could finally end the threat of the Lebanese armed group, while others viewed the rising violence with resignation.
articles.title: In Israel's north, stress and resignation as missiles fly

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden will look to burnish his foreign policy legacy in a U.N. speech on Tuesday, still facing the challenges posed by Ukraine's effort to repel Russian invaders and in a Middle East mired in war.
articles.title: Biden to address UN General Assembly for the last time as president

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: "The level of impunity in the world is politically indefensible and morally intolerable," Guterres said.
articles.title: UN chief condemns 'get out of jail free' card on wars

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia hit a high-rise apartment block in Ukraine's northeastern city of Kharkiv during an attack with guided bombs on Tuesday, killing at least three people and injuring 15 more, with others feared trapped under rubble, local authorities said.
articles.title: Russia strikes apartment block in Ukraine's Kharkiv, three killed, 15 injured

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden is determined to bring about a Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal with Hamas while also seeking to de-escalate tensions on Israel's border with Lebanon, White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Biden not giving up on Gaza ceasefire, hostages, White House says

articles.author: Michelle Nichols, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Israel is open to ideas for de-escalating the conflict in Lebanon, Israel's U.N. Ambassador Danny Danon said on Tuesday, a day after the United States said it was exploring some "concrete ideas" with allies and partners.
articles.title: Israel open to ideas to de-escalate in Lebanon, says Israel's UN envoy

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: The Russian parliament is working on a law that would ban what the authorities cast as the harmful promotion of a child-free way of life with heavy fines for "childlessness propaganda", a close ally of President Vladimir Putin said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia, battling birth rate dip, is working on 'child-free' ideology ban, says Putin ally

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tropical Storm John unleashed heavy rains along Mexico's southern Pacific coast as it moved inland on Tuesday morning, threatening dangerous flooding and causing at least two deaths in a mudslide.
articles.title: Tropical Storm John lashes Mexican coast, two killed in mudslide

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sri Lanka's newly elected President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has dissolved parliament to make way for a snap general election in the debt-ridden country, he said in a government gazette notification on Tuesday.
articles.title: Sri Lanka president dissolves parliament to make way for Nov. 14 polls
